title: Implementation of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act

enrichment.summary: This order establishes a coordinated federal effort to effectively implement the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act by setting priorities such as efficient use of funds, high labor standards, equity in investment, and climate resilience. It creates a task force chaired by senior White House officials to oversee and coordinate infrastructure projects across federal agencies, working closely with state, local, Tribal, and territorial governments.
potential_concerns: Coordinating multiple federal agencies and levels of government may delay project implementation and reduce efficiency.
Ensuring equitable distribution of infrastructure investments, especially to disadvantaged communities, may face measurement and enforcement challenges.
High labor standards and union requirements could increase project costs or lead to labor disputes.
Climate resilience and advanced environmental requirements might slow approvals or increase complexity of projects.
The task forceâ€™s broad membership and authority could create bureaucratic overlap or unclear accountability.
